snippet: The authorities said two brothers, Andy Ashkar, 34, and Nayel Ashkar, 36, had tricked the actual winner, a customer at their parents’ convenience store.
abstract: New York State Lottery officials say brothers Andy Ashkar and Nayel Ashkar lied to a customer at their parents' Syracuse convenience store, telling the holder of a winning $5 million New York State scratch-off lottery ticket that it was worth only $5,000, and then attempted to cash in the ticket for themselves; both have been charged with attempted grand larceny.
lead_paragraph: The authorities said two brothers, Andy Ashkar, 34, and Nayel Ashkar, 36, had tricked the actual winner, a customer at their parents’ convenience store.

headline.seo: Syracuse-Area Brothers Charged in Plot to Steal $5 Million Lottery Payout
headline.main: Upstate Brothers Are Charged in Plot to Steal a $5 Million New York Lottery Ticket
headline.print_headline: 2 Charged in Plot to Steal $5 Million Lottery Payout
